result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott C Carlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The sentence is case #14CF436 is concurrent with case #14CF289, but consecutive to any other sentence in being.

superMiscConds.notes:
--to pay restitution of $80.22 to Game Stop in Watertown
--to pay 10% restitution processing fee
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to maintain absolute sobriety, Mr. Carlin is not to possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances of any kind without a valid prescription. Mr. Carlin is to take any prescribed drugs as prescribed. 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent
--to obtain/maintan employment and/or education program per agent
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent
--to comply with DNA sample to DOC or designee upon demand

Arresting Agency: WTPD


  Pursuant to Wis. Stats. 303.01(8), and to facilitate the rehabilitative objective of sentencing, the Department of Corrections shall deduct 25% from inmate wages to pay restitution as ordered by the court.

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Cases #14CF436 and #14CF289 called at 2:17pm[MO]
Defendant Scott C Carlin in court, in custody, with Attorney David Zarwell.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

On Case, 14CF436: Mr. Carlin waives his right to preliminary hearing. The Court accepts the waiver and binds him over for trial. Service of Information admitted; reading waived. 

On Motion of the State, in case # 14CF289 the Court strikes the Repeater enhancer.

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "Guilty" entered in case #14CF289 and plea of "Guilty "entered on Count #1 in case #14CF436; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Carlin guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: in case #14CF436 Counts #2 and #3

In Case #14CF436 and Case #14CF289 the Court sentences Mr, Carlin  to 2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  1 year. THe sentence is case #14CF289 is consencutive to any other sentence in being. The sentence is case #14CF436 is concurrent with case #14CF289, but consecutive to anyother sentence in being.

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 

The Court gives  0   days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to maintain absolute sobriety, Mr. Carlin is not to possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances of any kind without a valid prescription. Mr. Carlin is to take any prescribed drugs as prescribed. 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent
--
to obtain/maintan employment and/or education program per agent
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent
--to comply with DNA sample to DOC or designee upon demand
--In case #14CF289 to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--In case #14CF436 to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--In case #14CF289 to pay restitution of $220 to Donovan Channing
--In case #14CF436 to pay restitution of $80.22 to Game Stop in Watertown
--to pay 10% restitution processing fee 


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess:2:42pm
Fax transmittal to DCI w/fax confirmation
Request for detainer w/fax confirmation attached
Status conference on February 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Scott C Carlin
Current: PO Box 700, c/o Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963-0700 United States  (Effective: 01-20-2015)
Prior: 216 W. Center St., C/O Dodge County Jail, Juneau, WI 53039 United States

Cases 14CF289 & 14CF436 called together at 8:55 am [Clerk SH] (Called early upon agreement of parties)
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Scott C Carlin appears via video, in-custody, with Attorney David Zarwell. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

14CF436: Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 
Atty Zarwell indicates that they are close to resolution; requests matter be set for STC in 5-6 weeks, which will likely be a plea/sentencing hearing so writ will be needed 
ADA Shock: No objection

Court requires a $1000 signature bond, with conditions:
-No contact with Jamie Radomski, Dennis Radomski, Meghan Macon or Brett Dunham  
Recess: 9:01 am 

NEXT: BOTH CASES: (1) Schedule STC 2/13/15 (likely plea/sentencing) at 1:30 pm  - Send notices
Court review case history, status and filing of this case and 14CF289 and directs that this case remain assigned to Br. 4.
Clerk's note to Court re: re-assignment of file.  Court directs that the case be rescheduled due to clerical error at the time of entry.
